channel.title: [718] So uhh dumb question
channel.description:
I'm trying to get a 718 client and server to connect but there's a error...
[code]error_game_js5connect[/code]
I'm absolutely 100% sure i'm missing something incredibly simple and before you say it...
1. Yes I changed the ip&port to match the server. 2. Yes it has been CORRECTLY port forwarded. 3. Yes the cache is exactly where it needs to be and works fine. 4. Yes the revisions match for client and server. 5. Yes the port has been confirmed open and google can see the server service running. 6. Server is completely loaded b4 Client
A bit of additional information for some reason or another it works perfectly on 127.0.0.1 but fails to connect when hosted either by direct ip or no-ip.
And i set up a debug message to figure out where its attempting to connect to and when the client does attempt a connection it does try the correct ip.
Debug messages also show a login was never attempted.
Note: This is in the server section because it deals with both client and server and cache and i had no idea where to stick it... And i know sk8r is about and he/she/they/it is awesome :)

item.title: [718] So uhh dumb question
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Pinging it will work, but Java won’t connect to it.

You have to connect it like so:
If the client and server are on the same machine: Localhost.
If the client and server are on the same network, but different machines: local address (the one you port forward with).
If the client and server are on different networks: public address (see: http://ip4.me )

Read full topic

item.title: [718] So uhh dumb question
item.dc:creator: @Roar337 Roar337
item.description:
@Roar337 wrote:

That’s weird I fail to understand let me clarify though

Test 1: Server = hosted on my machine & Client = Hosted on my machine told to connect to 127.0.0.1.
Test 2: Server = same & Client = myPubIp.

T1 = Success.
T2 = Fail.

Is this what you are saying wont work? really?
I wonder why…

Out of mere curriosity…
Is it something to do with the ports?
Because pings work fine…

Pinging EditedPubIpNo-Ip [EditedPubIp] with 32 bytes of data:
Reply from EditedPubIp: bytes=32 time=394ms TTL=64
Reply from EditedPubIp: bytes=32 time=211ms TTL=64
Reply from EditedPubIp: bytes=32 time=252ms TTL=64
Reply from EditedPubIp: bytes=32 time=717ms TTL=64

Ping statistics for EditedPubIp:
    Packets: Sent = 4, Received = 4, Lost = 0 (0% loss),
Approximate round trip times in milli-seconds:
    Minimum = 211ms, Maximum = 717ms, Average = 393ms

Also have you ever been involved in a project?

Read full topic

item.title: [718] So uhh dumb question
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Roar337, post:5, topic:554687”]Oh woops ill go respond again then missed that did you sort him out?

And no its not the correct client server pair its rune evo i downloaded foxtrots client but i know it works because i can login via localhost.[/quote]
Wait… Are you trying to login to the server, that’s running on localhost, via a client connecting to your IP? That won’t work, whatsoever.
If the server is on the same pc as the client, you have to use localhost. Otherwise your pc tries to connect to the IP on the internet, and will never find it… because it’s your IP.

Read full topic

item.title: [718] So uhh dumb question
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Roar337:

oh come now sk8r there was more to that post then that i also told him legitimately how to do it…

You really didn’t. You said to edit the char files, which the OP said couldn’t because they’re encoded in .dat format.

Are you sure you’re using the correct client/server pair? The client might be trying to read a value the server isn’t sending.

Read full topic
